ENTRY.refkeywords: xskyconv kyconv load_kyconv x-spec xspec convolution model experimental
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: convolution using a relativistic line from axisymmetric accretion disk. XSpec convolution model *Experimental*.

DESC.PARA: Convolution using as a kernel the relativistic line from an axisymmetic accretion disk. See Dovciak et al. (2004).

ROW.DATA: 0 means integrate from rin, 1 means integrate emission from above the marginally stable orbit only
accretion disk emissivity scales as r^-alpha for r<rb
accretion disk emissivity scales as r^-beta for r>rb
boundary radius between inner and outer emissivity laws (GM/c^2)
0 means isotropic emission, 1 means Laor's limb darkening (1+0.26\mu), 2 means Haardt's limb brightening (ln{1 + 1/\mu})
number of grid points in local energy (energy resolution of local flux, the grid is equidistant in logarithmic scale)
0 means normalize total flux to unity, +ve value means normalize to unity at the energy given by the parametervalue, -ve value means unnormalized.

DESC.PARA: Please see ahelp xsconvolve for information on how to load the model.

LIST.CAPTION: Notes
LIST.ITEM: This is an experimental release of the convolution models; please take care when using this model.

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.10.1n of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.12.
The powerlaw and gaussian components are convolved by the kyconv model, whose inclination angle is set at 45 degrees.
